alert.note: Alert for Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 1:17PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko NV has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Battle Mountain. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor to moderate lowland flooding throughout the reach. Some rural roads near the river are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM PDT Friday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening and continue rising to 10.0 feet early Wednesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.0 feet on 06/21/1896. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 130 AM PDT.
